00023    used to be a part of the Arduino project. */

00025 
00026 #include <math.h>
00027 #include <avr/pgmspace.h>
00028 #include "config.h"
00029 #include "serial.h"
00030 
00031 void printString(const char *s)
00032 {
00033   while (*s)
00034     serial_write(*s++);
00035 }
00036 
00037 // Print a string stored in PGM-memory
00038 void printPgmString(const char *s)
00039 {
00040   char c;
00041   while ((c = pgm_read_byte_near(s++)))
00042     serial_write(c);
00043 }

00045 // void printIntegerInBase(unsigned long n, unsigned long base)
00046 // { 
00047 //  unsigned char buf[8 * sizeof(long)]; // Assumes 8-bit chars. 
00048 //  unsigned long i = 0;
00049 // 
00050 //  if (n == 0) {
00051 //   serial_write('0');
00052 //   return;
00053 //  } 
00054 // 
00055 //  while (n > 0) {
00056 //   buf[i++] = n % base;
00057 //   n /= base;
00058 //  }
00059 // 
00060 //  for (; i > 0; i--)
00061 //   serial_write(buf[i - 1] < 10 ?
00062 //    '0' + buf[i - 1] :
00063 //    'A' + buf[i - 1] - 10);
00064 // }
00065 
00066 void print_uint8_base2(uint8_t n)
00067 { 
00068  unsigned char buf[8];
00069  uint8_t i = 0;
00070 
00071  for (; i < 8; i++) {
00072   buf[i] = n & 1;
00073   n >>= 1;
00074  }
00075 
00076  for (; i > 0; i--)
00077   serial_write('0' + buf[i - 1]);
00078 }
00079 
00080 static void print_uint32_base10(unsigned long n)
00081 { 
00082   unsigned char buf[32]; 
00083   uint8_t i = 0;
00084   
00085   if (n == 0) {
00086     serial_write('0');
00087     return;
00088   } 
00089   
00090   while (n > 0) {
00091     buf[i++] = n % 10;
00092     n /= 10;
00093   }
00094   
00095   for (; i > 0; i--)
00096     serial_write('0' + buf[i - 1]);
00097 }
00098 
00099 void printInteger(long n)
00100 {
00101   if (n < 0) {
00102     serial_write('-');
00103     n = -n;
00104   }
00105   print_uint32_base10(n);
00106 }
00107 
00108 void printFloat(double n)
00109 {
00110   if (n < 0) {
00111     serial_write('-');
00112     n = -n;
00113   }
00114   n += 0.5/DECIMAL_MULTIPLIER; // Add rounding factor
00115  
00116   long integer_part;
00117   integer_part = (int)n;
00118   print_uint32_base10(integer_part);
00119   
00120   serial_write('.');
00121   
00122   n -= integer_part;
00123   int decimals = DECIMAL_PLACES;  
00124   uint8_t decimal_part;  
00125   while(decimals-- > 0) {
00126     n *= 10;
00127     decimal_part = (int) n;
00128     serial_write('0'+decimal_part);
00129     n -= decimal_part;
00130   }
00131 }
